BIOGRAPHICAL SKETCH Provide the following information for key personnel in the order listed on Form Page 2. Photocopy this page or follow this format for each person.
NAME George Perry
POSITION TITLE
Professor

RESEARCH AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE: Concluding with present posting, list, in chronological order, previous employment, experience and honors. Include all present membership on any Federal Government public advisory committee. List, in chronological, the titles, all authors, and complete references to all publication during the past three years and to representative earlier publication pertinent to this application. If the list of publication in the last three years exceeds two pages, select the most pertinent publication. DO NOT EXCEED TWO PAGES.
RESEARCH AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
Assistant Professor, Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio 1982-89
Associate Professor, Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio, 1989-1994
Professor, Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio, 1994-
NIH Research Career Development Award, 1987-1993.
Neurological Sciences I, ad hoc Member 1988-89, Member 1989-93, Chair 1991-93
Neurological Sciences III, Member, 1995
Associate Editor, American Journal of Pathology 1994-
Selected Peer Reviewed Journal Articles:
Kawai M, Cras P, Richey P, Tabaton M, Lowery DE, Gonzalez-De Whitt P, Greenberg BD, Gambetti P, Perry G. Subcellular localization of amyloid precursor protein in senile plaques of Alzheimer's disease. Am J Pathol 140: 947-958, 1992.
Perry G, Cras P, Siedlak SL, Tabaton M, Kawai M. B-protein immunoreactivity is found in the majority of neurofibrillary tangles of Alzheimer disease. Am J Pathol 140: 283-290, 1992.
Kalaria RN, Kroon SN, Grohovac I, Perry G. Acetylcholinesterase is associated with heparan sulfate proteoglycans in cortical amyloid deposits of Alzheimer's disease. Neurosci 51: 177-184, 1992.
Kawai M, Cras P, Perry G. Serial reconstruction of ÃŸ-protein amyloid plaques: relationship to microvessels and size distribution. Brain Res 592: 278-282, 1992.
Perry G, Richey P, Siedlak SL, Galloway P, Kawai M, Cras P. Basic fibroblast growth factor binds to filamentous inclusions of neurodegenerative diseases. Brain Res 579: 350-352, 1992.
Perry G. Neuritic plaques in Alzheimer disease originate from neurofibrillary tangles. Med Hypotheses 40:257-258, 1993.
Kalaria RN, Bhatti S, Palatinsky E, Pennington DH, Shelton ER, Chan HW, Perry G, Lust WD. Accumulation of the B-amyloid precursor protein at sites of ischemic injury in rat brain. Neuroreport 4:211-214,1993.
Villanova M, Kawai M, Lubke U, Oh SJ, Perry G, Six J, Ceuterick C, Martin JJ, Cras P. Rimmed vacuoles of inclusion body myositis and oculopharyngeal muscular dystrophy contain amyloid precursor proteins and lysosomal markers. Brain Res 603:343-347,1993.
Sisodia SS, Koo EH, Hoffman PN, Perry G, Price DL. Identification and transport of full-length amyloid precursor proteins in rat peripheral nervous system. J Neurosci 13:3136-3142, 1993.
Kalaria RN, Golde T, Koon S, Perry G. Serine protease inhibitor antithrombin III and its messenger RNA in the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's disease. Am J Pathol 143:886-893, 1993.
Kawai M, Kalaria RN, Cras P, Siedlak SL, Velasco ME, Shelton ER, Chan HW, Greenberg BD, Perry G. Degeneration of vascular smooth muscle cells in cerebral amyloid angiopathy of Alzheimer disease. Brain Res 623:142-146, 1993.
DeWitt DA, Silver J, Canning DR, Perry G. Chondroitin sulfate proteoglycans are associated with the lesions of Alzheimer's disease. Exp Neurol 121:149-152, 1993.
